question: The House of Lords in Great Britain is mainly retained because?
option1: It is as important as the House of Commons
option2: It plays an important role of checks and balances
option3: It acts as a judicial court
option4: It is maintained as an institution
answer: It is maintained as an institution
explanation: The House of Lords in Great Britain is mainly retained because it is maintained as an institution. The House of Lords of Great Britain, referred to ceremonially as the House of Peers, is the upper house of the parliament of the United Kingdom.
